content: Singaporean footballer **Qayyum Raishyan bin Rahmat** (born 5 December 2000) is a Singaporean footballer who plays for [Malaysia Super League](/wiki/Malaysia_Super_League) club [Negeri Sembilan](/wiki/Negeri_Sembilan_FC). Currently playing Right Back (RB) position. He started his career early in his teenage years at Junior Soccer Academy (JSA) Singapore. He eventually went for trial and got selected for [National Football Academy (NFA) Singapore](/wiki/National_Football_Academy_(Singapore)). He played for Singapore U18 in 2018 and represented the country in many overseas matches during his term there. Nominated for the Dollah Kassim Award in 2016 due to his great performance at a young age. ## Career Raishyan started his senior career with [Young Lions](/wiki/Young_Lions_FC) in the [Singapore Premier League](/wiki/Singapore_Premier_League), where he has made nine league appearances and scored zero goals. - Versatile Qayyum This biographical article related to Singaporean association football is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Qayyum Raishyan
